newsitem.title: USA: U.S. EPA's Superfund chief Elliott Laws resigns.
newsitem.headline: U.S. EPA's Superfund chief Elliott Laws resigns.

text.p: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's assistant administrator for Solid Waste and Emergency Response, Elliott Laws, will leave the agency effective February 14, the EPA said Friday.
Laws, who guided the Superfund hazardous waste cleanup program, plans to return to his previous position as a partner in the law firm of Patton Boggs LLP, the EPA said.
Timothy Fields, currently Law's deputy, will serve as acting administrator until a replacement is named, the agency said.
EPA Administrator Carol Browner in a statement praised Laws as "one of EPA's most effective assistant administrators."
